meanings.definition: The quality of being inflexible or rigid.
meanings.sent1: Her inflexiblenesses in following the rules made her a reliable employee.
meanings.sent2: The inflexiblenesses of the metal rod made it difficult to bend.
meanings.sent3: The inflexiblenesses of the old tree made it impossible to climb.
meanings.sent4: His inflexiblenesses in his beliefs were like a wall that couldn't be moved.
meanings.sent5: The inflexiblenesses of the frozen ground made it impossible to dig.

meanings.definition: The state of being unwilling to change or compromise.
meanings.sent1: Their inflexiblenesses in negotiations led to a stalemate.
meanings.sent2: She showed her inflexiblenesses by refusing to consider any other options.
meanings.sent3: The inflexiblenesses of the stubborn cat made it impossible to coax it out of the tree.
meanings.sent4: His inflexiblenesses were like a shield against any attempts to sway his opinion.
meanings.sent5: The inflexiblenesses of the old clock meant it would never run again.

meanings.definition: The inability to bend or be flexible.
meanings.sent1: The inflexiblenesses of the plastic ruler made it snap when bent too far.
meanings.sent2: The tree's inflexiblenesses in the storm caused it to break under the pressure.
meanings.sent3: The inflexiblenesses of the frozen rope made it impossible to tie a knot.
meanings.sent4: His inflexiblenesses were like a rock in the river, unmoved by the current.
meanings.sent5: The inflexiblenesses of the steel beam made it a sturdy support for the building.
